title: Adventure Learning-Based Mathematical Problem-Solving Project

context.prior_knowledge: Requirement of intermediate theoretical background and practical experience
context.additional_context: A course for current secondary education practitioners to strengthen mathematical problem-solving competencies. Enhancing collaboration and critical thinking by addressing real-world educational/workplace problems through adventure learning

learning_goals: Participants enhance their ability to translate real-world educational field problems into mathematical models.
Participants successfully formulate problem-solving strategies for projects using data analysis tools with over 80% accuracy.
Participants iteratively engage in collaborative problem-solving processes through peer assessment and feedback systems, repeating the cycle at least three times.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
